function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Transmission rate estimates may lead to over-estimation or under-estimation of the actual transmission rate, impacting the effectiveness of control measures.","Impact":"Inaccurate transmission rate estimates can result in ineffective control and prevention of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Validate transmission rate estimates with multiple sources of data and incorporate uncertainty in the estimation process.","Technologies":"Data validation algorithms, uncertainty modeling techniques.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Health authorities, research institutions."},{"Description":"Under-reporting during weekends may lead to misleading transmission rate estimates, affecting the accuracy of disease spread predictions.","Impact":"Misleading transmission rate estimates can result in incorrect disease spread predictions and control measures.","Mitigation":"Implement methods to account for and correct for under-reporting during weekends in the estimation process.","Technologies":"Statistical correction models, weekend reporting adjustment algorithms.","People":"Data analysts, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Differences in epidemic baseline conditions, such as the number of exposed and infectious cases, can impact the accuracy of transmission rate estimates and disease spread modeling.","Impact":"Inaccurate baseline condition assessments can lead to incorrect estimation of transmission rates and disease spread dynamics.","Mitigation":"Incorporate comprehensive data on baseline conditions and assess the impact of variability on transmission rate estimates.","Technologies":"Data analytics tools, baseline condition modeling algorithms.","People":"Epidemiologists, data analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."}]}
